from typing import Any, Dict, Optional
import random


def generate(case_: int = 0) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    # Context setup
    ORIGINAL_QUESTION = "A ball is traveling along a straight road at a constant speed of $10\ \text{m/s}$ for $20\ \text{seconds}$. What is the total distance traveled?"
    ORIGINAL_UNITS = "m"

    PREDEFINED_VALUES = {"speed": 10, "time": 20, "unitsSpeed": "m/s", "unitsTime": "s", "unitsDist": "m"}
    TEST_VALUES = {"speed": 10, "time": 20, "unitsSpeed": "m/s", "unitsTime": "s"}
    CORRECT_ANSWER: Optional[int] = 200  # meters

    ABS_TOL = 1e-6
    REL_TOL = 1e-6
    test_results: Dict[str, Any] = {"pass": None, "message": ""}

    # Handle different cases
a = None
b = None
    if case_ == 0:
        speed = round(random.uniform(1, 100), 2)
        time = round(random.uniform(1, 60), 2)
        unitsSpeed = random.choice(["m/s", "km/h"])
        unitsDist = "m" if unitsSpeed == "m/s" else "km"
    elif case_ == 1:
        speed = PREDEFINED_VALUES["speed"]
        time = PREDEFINED_VALUES["time"]
        unitsSpeed = PREDEFINED_VALUES["unitsSpeed"]
        unitsDist = PREDEFINED_VALUES["unitsDist"]
    elif case_ == 2:
        if CORRECT_ANSWER is None:
            raise ValueError("Test case unavailable: CORRECT_ANSWER not provided")
        speed = TEST_VALUES["speed"]
        time = TEST_VALUES["time"]
        unitsSpeed = TEST_VALUES["unitsSpeed"]
        unitsDist = "m"  # lock to original units for verification
    else:
        raise ValueError(f"Unknown case_: {case_}")

    # Convert speed if necessary
    if unitsSpeed == "km/h" and unitsDist == "m":
        speed = speed * (1000 / 3600)  # convert km/h to m/s

    distance = speed * time  # Calculate distance based on d=vt

    # Verify CORRECT_ANSWER (only for case 2)
    if case_ == 2:
        expected = float(CORRECT_ANSWER)
        diff = abs(distance - expected)
        tol = max(ABS_TOL, REL_TOL * abs(expected))
        passed = diff <= tol
        test_results["pass"] = 1 if passed else 0
        test_results["message"] = (
            f"PASS — computed={distance} {unitsDist}, expected={expected} {unitsDist}"
            if passed else
            f"FAIL — computed={distance} {unitsDist}, expected={expected} {unitsDist}"
        )

    params = {
        "speed_value": speed, "speed_units": unitsSpeed,
        "time_value": time, "time_units": unitsDist,
    }
    correct_answers = {
        "distance_value": round(distance, 3), "distance_units": unitsDist,
    }

    return {"params": params, "correct_answers": correct_answers, "test_results": test_results}

<pl-solution-panel>
    <pl-hint level="1" data-type="text">
        To calculate the total distance traveled by the ball, we use the formula: 
        $$ d = v 	imes t $$ 
        where $d$ is the distance, $v$ is the speed, and $t$ is the time.
    </pl-hint>
    <pl-hint level="2" data-type="text">
        Here, the speed of the ball is given as {{params.speed}} {{params.unitsSpeed}} and the time it travels is {{params.time}} {{params.unitsTime}}.
    </pl-hint>
    <pl-hint level="3" data-type="text">
        Substituting the known values into the formula gives:
        $$ d = {{params.speed}} 	imes {{params.time}} $$
    </pl-hint>
    <pl-hint level="4" data-type="text">
        The calculated distance will be:
        $$ d = {{params.speed}} \times {{params.time}} = {correct_answers.distance} {{params.unitsDist}} $$
    </pl-hint>
</pl-solution-panel>
